title: What the hell is with this sudden surge of True Damage?
body:
Every rework these days seems to come with an enormous amount of true damage.
Gangplank's AAs hitting for 10-15% of your life as true damage.
Fiora killing you and having over **half her damage** as true damage.

I mean, true damage is fine, but it's everywhere now and it's so far beyond completely out of control.

You might want to re-read my initial post.

True Damage is a good way to help champions deal lots of damage without causing them turn soft targets into a fine red mist.

Riot has been trying to figure out how to make melee carries viable without simply giving them MOAR DAMAGE than ranged carries.  The formula they have found works best is to give melee carries some way to invalidate enemy defense.

If that's their goal wouldn't it make more sense to give %hp damage rather than true damage? At least that way they wouldn't be able to just delete carries the second theyre within melee range.

To be honest, im not overly fond of %hp damage OR true damage, at least not in the frequency/scale we've been seeing them lately. But if the objective is to allow melee carries to be relevant damage wise while also being able to build tanky enough to survive to do said damage, %hp would seemingly be better than true damage imo.

%HP damage falters against shields and gets blunted by by defense.  Typically %HP damage (physical or magical) is going to be vastly more effective against soft targets since they'll typically be grabbing one resist item and that's about it.  %HP damage mostly exists for the purpose of giving a champion relevant damage at all stages in the game against all targets without snowballing into itself too hard.

True damage is specifically for tackling hard targets.  Tanks, Juggernauts, Bruisers, heavy Fighters and the like.  If the damage were tuned to still be viable against these targets while being Physical or Magic, it would pop soft targets near instantly.

Combining the two means you want damage that is equally effective against all targets.  Case in point: Fiora.  Her whole thing is being able to effectively duel any champion in the game.  If her Innate was dealing physical damage it would be vastly inferior against hard targets.  If it were dealing flat True damage then it would likely be snowballing even *harder* against soft low HP folks.  As such, %HP True damage is the most workable solution.

Damage types are simply tools.

Why not have both? Flat true damage is very much not a problem when balanced properly, and helps against both squishies and tanks -- for your Vel'Koz, Cho'gath, and Ahri, this helps your damage stay relevant without being overpowered.

The only reason I personally feel %hp damage is a better option than true damage is because if you hit a tank with 200 true damage its not that big of a deal, but a carry getting hit for 200 true damage is going to be hurting a lot more simply because tanks have more health. At least with the %hp, a carry doesn't need to worry so much about getting chunked for huge quantities of health because of true damage.

But ill be honest, im no expert here and I don't have any numbers or anything to base my assumption on. Its purely an "on paper" sort of point im talking about, and as I said im not overly fond of either.

True, but that's the case with any flat damage, especially since squishies usually don't build much resistance. Take a Vel'Koz with {{item:3136}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3020}}, the mpen mastery (6%) and Mpen runes, against a squishy with MR/level blues.

30+26 MR blues at level 18 = 56 MR
56 x (0.65 x 0.94) = 34.216 MR after Void Staff and Mastery
34.216 - (15+15+7.8) = -3.6 MR after Boots, Haunting Guise/Liandry's, and Reds

You're dealing true damage either way against a squishy.
